Ad Text:
This organisation is looking for a Change Analyst (CA) to assist in managing change and communications across multiple IT projects and stakeholder groups including external agencies such as QLD Police Service and QLD Revenue Office.

The scope includes replacing multiple legacy IT systems that support camera detected offence processing, along with implementing new applications to support camera planning and scheduling, and data analytics and reporting services.

The CA will work closely with the Organisational Change Manager (OCM) and Program Manager at the program level, along with project managers, project team members, SMEs and key stakeholders, to assist in managing change related to each project.

A variety of communication channels, training interventions, and tools will be used to ensure stakeholders are engaged and supported through the change and have the tools and capability to be successful in adopting the new systems and processes.

The CA will be required to:
â€¢ Support the Organisational Change Manager to implement change plans and activities to support adoption of the new systems and processes delivered across the program
â€¢ Conduct and document change impact assessments, considering the impacts related to business process, organisational structure, roles and responsibilities, culture, tools, and technologies.
â€¢ Develop and deliver broad and targeted communications across multiple channels to effectively communicate change related information to internal and external stakeholders.
â€¢ Meet regularly with stakeholders (particularly end users) to assess change readiness and understand concerns, provide support, and seek feedback on how change can be implemented effectively based on user needs.
â€¢ Contribute to the design of training and support materials and participate in training related activities to build knowledge and capability.
â€¢ Support go-live activities and provide post rollout support and coaching and monitor adoption.

Skills Required
â€¢ High level experience in designing and implementing change initiatives to achieve project/program outcomes, particularly on IT centric modernisation projects.
â€¢ High level experience in stakeholder engagement, particularly end users of systems including management staff, and building relationships to support and lead people through change.
â€¢ Significant experience in assessing the impacts of a change initiative for specific teams and roles based on business process, technology, culture, and role responsibilities.
â€¢ Significant experience in designing and implementing communication plans to meet program/project and stakeholder needs including use of social media, internal web sites (such as sharepoint), other electronic media, collaboration tools, and print.
â€¢ Significant experience in designing and delivering training/support activities for (and guiding people through) the transition to new ways of working and adopting new systems and processes.

The following attributes are mandatory:
â€¢ 8+ yearsâ€™ experience in change and communications management working on large projects or programs of work related to IT systems.

The following attributes are highly desirable:
â€¢ Certification in Change Management (e.g., PROSCI, APMG) and/or tertiary studies related to organisational change
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, Psychology, HR, or related field

Salary: No contractor fees / two pay runs per week

Our client, a Federal Government department whose focus is improving the lives of Australians living with disability, require the services of four (4) technical business analysts for 12-month contracts.

Duties of the Technical Business Analysts:

Develop a traceability framework for project team members to follow to ensure all project deliverables link to an agreed business outcome via succinct and unambiguous business and technical requirements.
Elicit and document business and technical requirements to support the strategy and goals of the Agency as they relate to the Data & Analytics transformation program.
Analyse and document business process and data flows to provide current and future state context to support business and technical requirements.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business and technical requirements, including facilitating relevant workshops, meetings, working groups, etc.
Review and provide feedback on business and technical design documents to ensure designs align with expected business outcomes, as captured by business and technical requirements.
Input to the design and implementation of solutions that deliver to the business and technical requirements and meet the expected business and technical outcomes.

Skills and Experience Required - Technical Business Analysts:

Demonstrated expertise leading hands-on business and technical requirement development and stakeholder validation in a large-scale business data and analytics transformation program.
Experience implementing Data and/or Analytics products and services and accompanying data architecture (e.g. Data Models, ETL, data governance, security).
Demonstrated expertise documenting data and process flows to analyse and provide context to business and technical requirements.
Strong proficiency with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, Word
Practical Agile, Hybrid and/or Waterfall delivery framework experience.

About the role

As a Consultant at MacGregor Advisory Group, you will play a pivotal role in providing strategic, high-quality and cost-effective consulting services to our diverse client base across the Energy Transition. Based in our Melbourne or Sydney office, this full-time position offers the opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals and contribute to the continued growth and success of our dynamic organisation.

What you'll be doing

Collaborating with clients to identify and analyse their energy transition and decarbonisation challenges and requirements

Developing and implementing customised solutions to capture opportunities in the decarbonisation space and to drive operational efficiency and growth

Conducting in-depth market research and competitor analysis to inform strategic decision-making

Preparing comprehensive reports, presentations and proposals to effectively communicate insights and recommendations

Participating in the design and delivery of training programs to enhance clients' knowledge and capabilities

Maintaining strong relationships with clients and building a network of industry contacts

Continuously updating your knowledge of industry trends, technologies and best practices

What we're looking for

Relevant tertiary qualification in a field such as Engineering, Business or Commercial

Minimum 3 years of experience as a Consultant or in a similar client-facing role preferably with time at a Strategy Consultancy.

Demonstrated consulting experience is essential for this position

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think strategically

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner

Proficient in the use of relevant software and technology tools

Proficiency in Microsoft Office is required

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Passion for delivering exceptional client service and driving positive business outcomes

What we offer

At MacGregor Advisory Group, we pride ourselves on creating a supportive and inclusive work environment that fosters professional development and personal growth. In addition to a competitive salary, you'll enjoy a range of benefits, including:

Opportunity for career progression and leadership development

Extensive training and development in carbon markets and consulting

Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance

Collaborative team-based culture with regular social events

About us

MacGregor Advisory Group is a boutique Corporate Advisory Firm specialising in the Decarbonisation and the Energy Transition. Established in 2025, we have a comprehensive track record build up from decades of experience in our leadership team of helping our clients navigate complex challenges and achieve their strategic objectives. Our team of highly skilled professionals is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that drive sustainable growth and transformation.

If you're ready to take the next step in your consulting career, we encourage you to apply now.

Central Forecasting Team

Treasury is looking for talented, team-oriented, and highly motivated staff to fill positions in the Central Forecasting Team of the Macroeconomic Conditions and Population Division (MCPD).Â 

Treasuryâ€™s Central Forecasting Team (CFT) produces the economic forecasts and projections that underpin the Australian Governmentâ€™s economic narrative, working with teams across MCPD and Treasury. This is a great opportunity lead the team that drives the production of the Governmentâ€™s official macroeconomic forecasts, help frame the macroeconomic narrative, and support government decision making.

About the Roles

The Directors of CFT leads a talented and driven team that also develops and maintains the forecasting infrastructure, and the delivers several projects aimed at improving Treasuryâ€™s analytical frameworks and forecasts. The role requires significant experience with modelling, having a well-developed macroeconomic framework and coding capabilities. This position demands exceptional capability to lead, deliver, and innovate in a fast-moving and complex environment. The successful candidate will co lead the forecasting team to drive the teamâ€™s performance, development and wellbeing.

The role requires excellent conceptual and analytical skills, and a capacity to communicate clearly to a variety of audiences. Specific responsibilities include:

Managing forecasting processes within the Macroeconomic Conditions and Population Division.
Maintaining and further developing Treasuryâ€™s forecasting frameworks and infrastructure.
Building the modelling and forecasting capabilities of staff across the Division.
Leading the timely delivery of influential analysis to brief the Treasurer and Senior Treasury Executives on macroeconomic developments and policy settings.
Supporting the delivery of a pipeline of strategic projects across the Division.Â 

The successful applicant will have demonstrated experience:

Applying macroeconomic theory and frameworks, including working with macroeconometric models, preparing macroeconomic forecasts and exercising professional judgement.
Leading a team of people and building technical capability.
Communicating clearly and succinctly to influence a broad range of stakeholders.
Operating in a dynamic setting as a team player, working productively across the Division and the Department and exercising sound judgement.Â 

Desirable Qualifications / Experience

Tertiary qualification(s) in a relevant field, including, but not limited to, economics, econometrics, mathematics, or public policy.
Ideally, we are looking for candidates with at least eight years of relevant work experience.

Experience in one or more of the following will be particularly well-regarded:Â 

Applied economic research and analysis
Government policy development and assessment
Relevant private-sector experience.
